entry.title: Combined summary - BIP 31
entry.summary: On April 11, 2012, an email discussion took place between Luke-Jr and Mike Hearn regarding the implementation of a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) for the pong message. Mike provided a link to the BIP 0031 on the en.bitcoin.it wiki, which specifies rules for handling the pong message used to check if a connection between two nodes is still active. However, Luke-Jr had previously suggested using the protocol version bump 60001 instead. Jeff Garzik, founder of exMULTI, Inc., also participated in the conversation and stated that he approved of Mike's original pull. Pull #1081 was referenced as making a few minor revisions along these lines. The proposal includes detailed technical specifications and guidelines for implementing these rules, improving the overall quality and reliability of the Bitcoin network.
